intro: Caltha gorovii, commonly known as the Gorovii marsh marigold, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features bright yellow flowers that typically appear in early spring, often emerging through the snow. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a rough texture and a distinctive reddish underside. Caltha gorovii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and wetlands.
